intro: Kohleria serrulata, commonly known as the serrated kohleria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, which bloom in clusters. Kohleria serrulata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
